We have an issue with Mockito. The `verifyZeroInteractions()` method has been deprecated and removed in newer versions of Mockito. It's been replaced with `verifyNoInteractions()` or `verifyNoMoreInteractions()`. Let's check and fix that:
xmpp-server/core/impl/src/test/java/rocks/xmpp/session/server/IQRouterTest.java:        Mockito.verifyZeroInteractions(testSession1);
Good, only one file. Let's fix it:

The issue is with Java 17's module system. The code is using Weld/CDI and it's trying to access internal Java classes. We need to add `--add-opens` JVM arguments to allow this. Let's update the surefire plugin configuration to add these arguments:

Text replacement complete and details displayed in console.
File: /tmp/workdir/baseline_strands_restricted_shell_20260128/babbler/pom.xml
Replaced 1 occurrence
Old string:                 <plugin>
                    <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                    <artifactId>maven-surefire-plugin</artifactId>
                    <version>3.0.0</version>
                    <configuration>
                        <argLine>@{jacocoArgLine} -Xmx1024m</argLine>
                    </configuration>
                </plugin>
New string:                 <plugin>
                    <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                    <artifactId>maven-surefire-plugin</artifactId>
                    <version>3.0.0</version>
                    <configuration>
                        <argLine>@{jacocoArgLine} -Xmx1024m --add-opens java.base/java.lang=ALL-UNNAMED --add-opens java.base/java.lang.reflect=ALL-UNNAMED</argLine>
                    </configuration>
                </plugin>
